prompt: Create Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 MDT configuration for hardware inventory/state: stream inventory entities and platform slot instance state. Use gRPC no TLS. Collector 192.0.2.196 port 57500. Sample every 10 minutes.
candidate:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INVENTORY-ENTITIES
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-sdr-invmgr-oper:sdr-inventory
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-sdr-invmgr-diag-oper:diag/racks/rack/slots
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv4
   destination 192.0.2.196
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription INVENTORY-STATE
  sensor-group-id INVENTORY-ENTITIES sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !
expected:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INV-OPER
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory/entities/entity
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper:platform/racks/rack/slots/slot/instances/instance/state
 !
 subscription SUB-INV
  sensor-group-id INV-OPER sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-INV
 !
 destination-group DG-INV
  address-family ipv4 192.0.2.196 port 57500
   encoding self-describing-gpb
   protocol grpc no-tls
  !
 !
!
rationale: The candidate config correctly uses gRPC no TLS, IP 192.0.2.196, port 57500, and self-describing-gpb encoding, meeting the hard requirements. However, the sensor-paths differ significantly from the expected ones: candidate includes broader inventory and sdr-inventory paths, while the expectation specifies precise inventory entities and platform slot instance state paths. The destination group naming and structure also differ, but this is less critical. Overall, the config is mostly correct but sensor-paths are not closely aligned with the request, warranting a moderate score.
